reviewText:
This game is rage-inducing, challenging, and has made me angry at my controller countless times within the first 20 minutes of playing. Oh wait, not countless times. Exactly 97 times within 20 minutes. That's how many times I died within the first 14 levels on easy mode.

Super Robot Jump Jump is a fantastic platformer true to the genre. There aren't any deviations from what it claims to be. It is a challenging platformer through and through. The music sets the tempo of the game as you blast through parts of the level after dying to a god damn cloud over and over again. As soon as you make an error you tap Y (on the gamepad, my preferred method of platforming) and reset the level immediately. The pace is fast, the challenge is high, and the rewards are great!

There is no feeling like that of completing a level that increased my death counter from 47 to 82 (Level 12 Ugh). The art is cartoony and whimsical with a story and voice over work that matches that feeling beat for beat. If you enjoy challenging platformers like Super Meat Boy or comedic platformers such as BattleBlock Theater, I would definitely recommend Super Robot Jump Jump.

reviewText: I'm honestly not a huge platformer fan so I went into this a bit hesitant. I just finished Salt and Sanctuary and am eagerly anticipating Dark Souls 3. After a few hours of SRJJ my controller is adequately sweaty and I am equally as salty. I'm only on level 27 but this game is really fantastic if you're willing to put in the time. Controller is highly advised. Good, brief narrative cutscenes and some really fantastic soundtrack (Volcano level is epic as hell)

There are two modes , easy and hard.  I highly recommend starting on easy mode, because to be honest, it gets fairly difficult early on even on easy".  Of course if you really want to feel that adrenalin when you RAGE

reviewText:
A tough 2D platformer that struggles with pacing, and sometimes feels more like a chore than playing a game.

Video Review: https://youtu.be/0bCZItcdZf8

This game is fun for a little while, once your past about the first stage and boss, you spend the first few levels in a new area enjoying the new mechanics, then those mechanics get taken to insane levels until playing this game is more like creating your own death montage on the fly.

Nothing wrong with that, one of my biggest problems, is that the later levels don't tend to add much other than just the same mechanics introduced earlier, but harder versions of them.

After about half way in each area, I found myself exiting back to the map to see if I was almost at the boss, to which I'd realize I still had 5 or 6 levels left and would reluctantly start playing again to reach the next boss.

Synopsis: A difficult platformer, with a nice art style, cute little robot pal, voice acted bland storey that gets a bit boring after a few levels in a new area until you reach the boss and play the next few levels in the next area, rinse and repeat.

Edit: I added a more detailed review, as it seems some people weren't finding it helpful. :)

reviewText: Very fun game and very challenging,  especially on hard. If you enjoyed Super Meat Boy, highly recommend checking this out. EDIT: I've put more time into this game and just wanted to add, I'm on normal mode and up to 2300 deaths already, after completing world 3 (60 levels). This game is very good at tilting me, but at the same time, making me want to push myself to beat the next level and this is on normal mode. If you like a challenge, I highly recommend giving this game a shot.

reviewText:
This Game is a Challenge!
Lots of silliness to be had, and a great time with a second Player to join in on some Co-op.
I do not know if I can get to the end of the Story, to enjoy the whole thing, my skills are low, but practice helps.
The feel of the Robot in air is interesting, and certain level mechanics feel unique.
Give it a try, eh

reviewText: A charming and somewhat challenging platformer with quite a lot of character. Starts off very easy, and the difficulty curve is very gentle, but it gets fairly challenging after a while. It's nothing revolutionary, but it's really solid and enjoyable.

reviewText: Awesome game! Tons and tons of levels that start out nice and easy to teach you the mechanics and then ramp up to crazy hard. The art style is really nice, but the best thing is the smooth perfect controls. Lots of other platformers don't get this right, but Super Robot sure does! It has has local multiplayer so it's great to play on the couch with a friend and leave them to die as you race through the level :)

reviewText: The dev obviously plays these types of games a lot cause the controls are tight and it's just hard enough that you know you can get past it but it's still really challenging. The narration overlay makes for nice company too while you're trying to get through the same set of obstacles over and over too. 5/7 would rage again.

reviewText: This hard as nails platformer will have your palms sweating in no time. The controls are really tight; if you miss a jump it's your own fault, or should I say Jump Jump. Love the driving music in the volcano levels. Definitely recommended.
Possibly too many phallic innuendo's for my taste, but if you like dying, and the challenges that come with dying, over, and over -- this one's for you.
